page.title: 02SAWBRIDGEWORTH
page.content: Many of Sawbridgeworth's buildings date from medieval days,evidence has been found which clearly shows that the first settlers came to the area nearly 3,000 years ago.The name of Sawbridgeworth is derived from the Old English of Sabrixteworde,meaning the settlement beside the bridge made of withies.It was first mentioned in the Domesday Survey of 1086 and the manor was granted to Geoffrey de Mandeville by William the Conqueror.But later the estates were lost by Geoffrey's son in the 12th Century.Time has worked further changes but when expansion and development came,the town still retained its charm.
